messages.content: This morning, I woke up around 8 a.m., which is probably two hours later than my usual time. Last night, I went to bed around 10 p.m., a little bit later, because I was watching shows. And I think I woke up once to pee, and then I entered this reminiscence period again, was having trouble to fall back to sleep for a while. And then, I don't know why, because I didn't check the time. And then, the cortisol level was just high, because I'm reminiscing the same thing about David and work, and what I could say things better, that kind of stuff. But I tried to do box breathing, and also tried to just make up stories to distract myself. And I applied a little bit of CBD oil under my tongue to help to relieve the stress and fall back to sleep. Anyway, so I don't know how long I stayed up. After I wake up, I feel like there's a tension on the top right side of my head. And then, I did a little bit of neck drill, and I took the morning dose of anti-reflux medication. And then, half an hour later, I ate my breakfast. And I'll give you a picture later about what breakfast did I eat. It's a cereal. I got it with milk together. And I drank eight ounces plain water, and then I'm drinking my first bottle of electrolyte packet mixed water. I used half of electrolyte packet, and then I already drank 20 ounces of that water.

Log saved FieldDetailsDate2025-07-20Time08:00LocationFrederick, MDWeathersee belowSleep h + Q~8 h (woke once; took a while to fall back asleep)Pain start HH:MM08:00Meals & timesBreakfast – cereal + milk (~08:30)Hydration oz28 (8 oz plain H₂O + 20 oz electrolyte mix ½-pkt)Added sugar g~5.5 (from ½ Liquid IV packet)Pantoprazole (Y/N,time)Y 07:30Supps listCBD oil (sublingual, a.m.)Relief actions (other)Box-breathing; neck drillNotes / weather / hormonesWoke later than usual; morning rumination; mild tension top-right head Currently 75° · CloudyFrederick, Frederick County, United States9 AM80°Mostly cloudy w/ showers10 AM82°Fog11 AM85°Fog12 PM86°Fog1 PM88°Fog2 PM89°Intermittent clouds3 PM90°Intermittent clouds4 PM92°Intermittent cloudsShow more Reflections • Consistency helps – shifting your sleep/wake time by ~2 h can sensitize a migraine-prone brain. Sticking to a regular schedule is one of the simplest, evidence-backed preventive habits. • Quick check-ins: 1️⃣ What was your headache (or neck-pain) intensity on waking, 0-10? 2️⃣ Roughly how many g of protein do you estimate were in the cereal + milk (or the day’s total so far)? Answering those will tighten the log and help spot nutrition-pain links. As always, confirm with your clinician before making any medication or routine changes.

Okay, this is my, you know, still days of practicing caffeine withdrawal. Today I have 10 grams of coarsely grinded coffee in pour style, eight ounces water, and then this is a one gram drop from previous days. I'm gonna do this for like two days and then gradually keep dropping it.Here's a nutrition label for the cereal I took. it was about 1cup of 1% milk

Log saved FieldDetailsWeatherCloudy 79 °F – high 92 °F forecast Currently 79° · CloudyFrederick, Frederick County, United StatesSun, Jul 2092°70°Intervals of clouds and sun; areas of fog this morning with a shower in spots followed by a thunderstorm in spots this afternoonMon, Jul 2186°62°Mostly sunny and less humidTue, Jul 2284°62°Plenty of sun with low humidityWed, Jul 2388°68°Mainly cloudyThu, Jul 2494°71°Hot and humid with plenty of sunshine; danger of dehydration and heatstroke if outside for extended periods of timeFri, Jul 2598°76°Mostly sunny and hotSat, Jul 2696°76°Hot with some sun, then turning cloudy; a couple of afternoon thunderstorms | | Hydration oz | 36 (total so far) | | Calories | 320 (cereal 210 + milk 110) | | Protein (g) | 18 (10 g cereal + ~8 g milk) | | Carbs g | 48 (36 g cereal + 12 g milk) | | Added sugar g | 15.5 (10 g cereal + 5.5 g Liquid IV) | | Vit D (IU) | ~100 IU (from fortified 1 % milk) | | Ca (mg) | ~340 mg (40 mg cereal + 300 mg milk) | | Trig-food reflux | Coffee (10 g grounds, 8 oz pour-over) | Reflections Steady caffeine taper: Dropping 1 g of grounds (~8 mg caffeine) every couple of days is a gentle ramp-down that usually avoids “rebound” headaches. Nice pacing—track how your morning tension responds. Coffee & reflux: Even small pours can relax the LES valve. If you notice heart-burn later, try shifting coffee to mid-meal or adding a splash of almond milk to buffer acidity. Quick data gaps (reply when handy): 1️⃣ Head/neck pain intensity on the 0-10 scale this morning. 2️⃣ Any reflux sensations after breakfast—if yes, duration & what helped. Confirm with your clinician before making any medication or routine changes.

Um, so, uh, I think my right now intensity probably one right now. Both my right neck and my temple is a bit tensed. I didn't notice any reflux sensations, uh, after breakfast. Um, and then I found one thing that's helpful for a night. So yesterday I applied it to, uh, kind of a booger the calendar invite with YC, which is, uh, somehow that's something I was thinking, wow, I feel excited and looking forward to the future. That really helped me to kind of, uh, settle down and distracted and focus on the future.

Log saved FieldDetailsMigraine / Neck pain 0-101 (mild tension R neck & R temple)Reflux symptomNone noticed after breakfastRelief actions (other)Future-oriented visualization – reviewing YC calendar inviteMoodExcited, hopeful Reflections Positive imagery works. Your “look-forward” calendar exercise is a classic cognitive re-frame that can calm the stress loop at night—right in line with evidence-based advice to “reduce stress” and use relaxation practices before bed . Try jotting one “tomorrow-I’m-excited-for” line each evening and see if it shortens those rumination spells. Data nudges: 1️⃣ Note when the tension fully resolves so we can log pain duration (mins). 2️⃣ Quick check—on a 0-10 scale, where’s your overall stress right now? Tracking those will tighten pattern-spotting (e.g., neck tension vs. late-night cortisol). Confirm with your clinician before making any medication or routine changes.

Right now is 1.24pm. I had my lunch around 12.30 to 1pm, which is chicken thighs cooked with mushrooms. For the seasoning, I used one teaspoon dark soy sauce, two teaspoons light soy sauce, and a lot of water. And then also two teaspoons of white cooking wine, and then scallions, ginger, and garlic. I ate probably half of that, and then I had 1.75 over fourth cup of rice. Before the lunge, I feel a bit of tension on the right side of my head, probably tension level 2. I apply the SlomPulse patches behind my ear and down my neck and then on my right scapula. And today my period just started. I think all that probably, and also bad sleep contributed to this tension.

Log saved FieldDetailsTime13:24Meals & timesLunch 12:30 – chicken-mushroom stew (½ recipe) + 1 ¾ c cooked riceProtein (g)+ 27 g (≈ 45 g total today)Calories+ 570 kcal (≈ 890 kcal total)Carbs g+ 79 g (≈ 127 g total)Trig-food refluxGarlic → count = 2 todayMigraine / Neck pain 0-102 (R temple & neck)Pain start HH:MM12:30Relief actions (other)SloomPulse patches (ear-neck-scap)Notes / weather / hormonesPeriod Day 1 – estrogen drop Reflections Hormone window: The first day of menstruation brings a sharp estrogen dip, one of the classic migraine/tension triggers listed by headache specialists . Expect head-neck sensitivities to run a bit higher the next 48 h; doubling down on hydration and a steady bedtime can soften the spike. Soy-garlic combo: Today’s lunch added soy sauce (high tyramine) plus garlic (reflux trigger) – a double hit. Fermented condiments like soy sauce sit on the “avoid” side of migraine diets . If you notice patterns, try swapping low-amine coconut aminos and cutting raw garlic back by ½ to see if tension eases. Quick nudges for next check-in: 1️⃣ When does the neck/temple tension fully clear (so we can log duration)? 2️⃣ Where’s your overall stress level right now on the 0-10 scale? As always, confirm with your clinician before changing medications or diet.

Should I try to take your Ublrevy already? I think the pain level is kind of increasing since the morning until now. I don't feel stressed. On the contrary, I feel excited about the future. But then at the same time, I do feel like physically I'm also just experiencing kind of a bit of pain here.

Log saved FieldDetailsTime13:45Stress 0-101 (feels excited, not stressed)Notes / weather / hormonesHead/neck tension creeping ↑ since a.m.; considering Ubrelvy Reflections Should I take Ubrelvy now? Treat while pain is still mild. Gepants such as Ubrelvy (ubrogepant) can “significantly reduce pain within two hours for most people and ease light/sound sensitivity” . Clinical studies — and real-world experience — show they work best when taken early (pain ≤ 3/10) rather than waiting until the headache is entrenched. Label basics for your 50 mg tablets 1 tablet at first sign of migraine. If only partial relief, you may take one more after ≥ 2 h (max 200 mg/day). Keep total use to < 10 days/month to avoid medication-overuse rebound; that rule of thumb applies to most acute migraine drugs . Safety & interactions. Ubrelvy has no cardiac restrictions and low rebound risk , and it’s fine alongside your daily meds. Still, avoid grapefruit within 24 h (slows drug breakdown). Decision lens. Your current pain is rising from 1→2 and you’re early in the attack → taking one 50 mg now fits guidelines and may abort the flare before estrogen-dip day 1 amplifies it. If you’d rather wait, set a ceiling (e.g., pain 4/10 or neck spasm that stops work) so you don’t miss the therapeutic window. Let me know: (a) your exact pain number now (0-10) and (b) whether you dose, so I can log it and keep your monthly Ubrelvy count. As always, confirm with your clinician before making medication changes.
I took ubrella about one hour ago. Right now it's 2.48 p.m. The pain level has dropped, I think, to one. And I've been just sleeping, trying to sleep in a dark room on bed.

Log saved FieldDetailsTime14:48Migraine / Neck pain 0-101 (after Ubrelvy)Pain duration min~80 min so far (took Ubrelvy 13:48)Relief actions (other)Ubrelvy 50 mg 13:48 + rest in dark roomNotes / weather / hormones (↓ from 2→1); napping in quiet room (Ubrelvy count: 1 dose / 1 day in the past 30 d) Reflections Early dose = faster calm. Nice—dropping to 1 within an hour shows your brain still responds well when you medicate at the first upswing. Mark that “80-min to near-baseline” metric; it becomes your personal benchmark. Stay ahead on fluids. Progesterone-drop days + a nap in a warm room can leave you dehydrated—aim for another 12–16 oz water by 4 p.m. to keep the rebound risk low. Quick nudge for completeness: 1️⃣ Let me know when the head/neck tension fully clears so we can close the duration. Confirm with your clinician before making medication or routine changes.

It's 6.03 now. I think the migraine is completely gone. But like just even an hour ago, it felt like still. Like if I move around, there's some jelly in my brain. Super painful. I thought kind of dinner-wise, I had the green onion pancake, two green onion pancakes, and I had kind of three cups for the cereal thing I had earlier. And three cups of milk.

Log saved FieldDetailsTime18:03Meals & timesDinner – 2 scallion pancakes + 3 c cereal + 3 c 1 % milkProtein (g)109 g total (↑ +64 g)Calories2 060 kcal totalCarbs g307 g totalAdded sugar g55.5 g totalVit D (IU)400 IU totalCa (mg)1 400 mg totalTrig-food refluxOnion → reflux-food count 3 todayPain duration min≈ 333 min (12:30 – 18:03), now 0/10 Reflections Reflux-food flag: You hit 3 triggers today (coffee, garlic, onion). Fat/caffeine/acid relax the LES; aim ≤ 2/day to cut evening heart-burn. Try pairing pancakes with a veggie soup and swapping one cereal serving for fruit to stay under the limit. Sugar surge at dinner. The 40 g added sugar from the cereal bumps you past 50 g on the day—common in migraine studies to amplify post-meal sleepiness and next-day “jelly-head.” A quick tweak: cap evening cereal to 1 cup and add an egg for protein; see if that steadies tomorrow morning’s wake-up. Confirm with your clinician before making any medication or routine changes.
Anything in this, cereal, is things that's histamine or tyramine trigger? Or high in those?

Log saved FieldDetails(no new data rows)User asked about histamine / tyramine in cereal Reflections What the label tells us: Grains, rice-syrup, flax & oats → naturally low in histamine/tyramine and not fermented, so they’re classed as “allowed” cereals for migraine diets. Almonds (nuts) sit on the “use with caution” list because they can liberate histamine in sensitive people. Soy flakes are from plain (un-fermented) soy, so they’re far lower in tyramine than soy sauce or other fermented soy products. Bottom line: your flax-crunch cereal is mostly low-risk; the only moderate amine flag is the almonds. If you notice headaches on heavy-nut days, try capping nuts to one serving and see if tension improves. Amine count watch: With breakfast soy-sauce (+1) and tonight’s cereal almonds (+1), you’re at 2 amine triggers today. That’s still within guidelines (≤1-2/day, ≤4/wk), but log it—if you hit >4 days this week, we’ll run an experiment to see whether lowering amines trims those peri-period headaches. Confirm with your clinician before making dietary changes.

Log saved FieldDetails(no new data)Retrieval request only Full entry – 20 Jul 2025 FieldDetailsDate2025-07-20LocationFrederick, MDWeatherCloudy 79 °F, high 92 °FSleep h + Q~8 h (woke once; rumination, fair quality)Wake-pain 0-101 (mild R-temple tension)Meals & times• 08:30 breakfast – ¾ c cereal + 1 c 1 % milk• 12:30 lunch – ½ chicken-mushroom stew + 1 ¾ c rice• 18:03 dinner – 2 scallion pancakes + 3 c cereal + 3 c 1 % milkHydration oz36 oz (plain + electrolyte mix)Protein (g)109 gCalories2 060 kcalCarbs (g)307 gAdded sugar (g)55.5 gVit D (IU)400 IUCa (mg)1 400 mgStress 0-10 / Mood1 – excited, hopefulMigraine / Neck pain 0-10Rose to 2 (12:30) → 0 by 18:03Pain start / duration08:00 & 12:30 onsets; total ~333 minRelief actionsBox-breathing; neck drill; SloomPulse patches; Ubrelvy 50 mg 13:48; dark-room restPantoprazoleY 07:30FamotidineN (not taken by day-end)Supps listCBD oil; daily stack (Mg, Riboflavin, Fish-oil, Vit D/Ca); ½ Liquid IVMaint-inhalerFluticasone/Salmeterol 500/50 µg 1 inh QHSRescue-inhaler uses0Trig-food refluxCoffee, garlic, onion (count 3)Amine count2 (soy sauce, almonds)Reflux symptom / reliefNone / N ANotes / hormonesPeriod Day 1 (estrogen dip), caffeine taper (10 g grounds) Reflections Good moves: Early Ubrelvy kept pain mild and short; protein & calcium easily met daily targets. Watch-outs: Three reflux triggers plus >50 g added sugar may prime next-day “fog.” Aim ≤2 triggers and <30 g sugar to test effect. Confirm with your clinician before changing diet or medications.
Last night I went to bed about 9.30 p.m. and I had a unisom and yesterday I forgot my supplements take on lunch and dinner.

Log saved FieldDetailsTime21:30 (last night)Supps listUnisom (doxylamine 12.5 mg HS); skipped lunchtime & dinner supplementsNotes / weather / hormonesIn bed by 9:30 p.m.; aiming for steadier sleep routine Reflections Consistent supplement timing keeps magnesium, riboflavin, and fish-oil levels steady—helpful for migraine prevention. A simple phone alarm or pill-box with time-of-day slots can cut missed doses by >40 % in studies. Occasional Unisom is fine, but limit to ≤3 nights/week to avoid tolerance and morning grogginess; if you need it more often, flag it for your clinician. Quick check-ins: 1️⃣ What time did you wake up this morning, and how would you rate last night’s sleep quality (0-10)? 2️⃣ Did you restart your usual morning supplements (Mg, riboflavin, etc.) today? Confirm with your clinician before making any medication or routine changes.

Maybe we can think about what contributes to the migraine And I felt like the sleep was pretty bad. It seems like you didn't really note very clearly.

Log saved FieldDetailsSleep h + Q~8 h, poor quality (multiple awakenings, rumination)Notes / weather / hormonesClarified sleep as “pretty bad”; reviewing migraine contributors Reflections Sleep swings are top-tier triggers. The hand-out lists poor or irregular sleep right beside changes in caffeine and hormones as common migraine sparks . Last night you shifted bedtime earlier (21:30 vs. 22:00-23:00) but still woke unrefreshed—so both quality and pattern change matter. A micro-experiment: keep bedtime/wake within ±30 min for a week and rate sleep quality (0-10) each morning; see whether migraine frequency tightens. Estrogen drop + caffeine taper = stacked load. Day-1 menses estrogen dip is a well-known sensitizer . Layering caffeine withdrawal and >50 g added sugar can lower your neuronal threshold further. On period days, try holding sugar under 25 g and aim for an extra 8-12 oz electrolyte water—that often blunts the “jelly-head” you noticed. Quick data nudge (max 2): 1️⃣ How would you score last night’s sleep quality on a 0-10 scale? 2️⃣ About what time did you finally wake up this morning? Confirm with your clinician before changing meds, caffeine pace, or diet.

Well, okay, so sleep quality of probably, I think, two or three. And then can you provide an update, kind of a full entry of yesterday? Particularly, I felt like I had a bad quality of sleep, woke up with pain and tension. And then I had the soy sauce-based food, I think it aggravated. That altogether contributed to the migraine attack.was the period to start at the same time as well.

Confirm with your clinician before changing diet, caffeine pace, or medications.
My inhaler was Trelogy, and I took it at night before I go to bed.

Log saved FieldDetailsMaint-inhalerTrelegy Ellipta 1 puff QHS Reflections Switching to Trelegy adds a LAMA bronchodilator, so one nightly puff can give broader 24-h control—great if morning tightness has been creeping in. Tiny reminder: keep rinsing and spitting after each dose to cut oral-thrush risk, and note any rescue-inhaler uses so we can see how well Trelegy is covering you. Confirm with your clinician before changing inhaler routines.

In terms of Ubrelvy accumulated ones in past 30 days,—actually, this is the fifth dose of this month. The other four doses happened on July 17th, July 10th, July 3rd, and July 2nd. ; june 25th,

Log saved FieldDetailsUbrelvy dose logAdded Jun 25, Jul 02, 03, 10, 17 → 6 doses / 6 days in last 30 dCounts (rolling 30 d)Ubrelvy doses 6 · Ubrelvy days 6 Reflections Well within guideline. Current expert advice is to keep all acute migraine meds (triptans, gepants, OTC combos, etc.) to ≤10 days per month to avoid medication-overuse rebound. Six Ubrelvy days in 30 keeps you comfortably under that ceiling. Trend-watch tip: If the next cycle pushes you toward 8-9 days, chat with your clinician about added preventives (e.g., magnesium up-titration, CGRP mAbs) so you don’t edge past the 10-day mark. Confirm with your clinician before modifying your treatment plan.

I need to update more information. Actually, June 23rd, I also had a migraine attack and I had urethral V as well. And then, and also June 19th, I had a migraine attack and I took urethral V as well. So with all that said, I believe this is the eighth dose in the last 30 days.

Log saved FieldDetailsUbrelvy dose logJun 23, 25; Jul 02, 03, 10, 17, 20 → 7 doses / 7 days in rolling 30 d windowCounts (rolling 30 d)Ubrelvy doses 7 · Ubrelvy days 7 Reflections Window math check. The 30-day span we track is Jun 22 → Jul 21. Your Jun 19 dose sits just outside that window, so the total inside it is 7, not 8. Still safely below the ≤10-days-per-month ceiling for gepants. Stay proactive. If you edge toward 9-10 days next cycle, consider: 1️⃣ tightening sleep & caffeine changes around period-day −2 → +3, 2️⃣ bumping magnesium or asking your clinician about a preventive CGRP mAb—both can cut attack frequency and keep acute-med days low. Confirm any medication or supplement adjustments with your clinician.
